item.title: Cannes Film Festival: Titane wins top Palme d'Or prize
item.description: The outlandish Titane wins after jury president Spike Lee reveals the award in a ceremony slip-up.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival 2021 highlights: Sun, stars and saliva
item.description: A-listers flocked to the Cannes Film Festival's red carpet, despite the pandemic.

item.title: Stephen Fretwell: 'Gavin and Stacey song equated to a part-time job'
item.description: Stephen Fretwell on his hit TV show theme tune and why his 13-year music hiatus has come to an end.

item.title: Inhaler: Bono's son and his band top UK chart with debut album
item.description: Elijah Hewson's rock group knock Olivia Rodrigo off the top spot with their debut album.

item.title: Row brewing in Scotland over prospect of privatising Channel 4
item.description: Some production companies fear a privatised channel would spend less money and support fewer jobs in Scotland.

item.title: GB News says presenter Guto Harri breached standards by taking the knee
item.description: Guto Harri is not expected to appear for the rest of the summer after making the gesture on air.

item.title: Pulitzer-winning photojournalist killed in Afghanistan
item.description: Danish Siddiqui, an award-winning photographer with Reuters news agency, is killed on assignment.

item.title: Surekha Sikri: 'Force of nature' Indian actress dies at 75
item.description: Tributes are paid by Bollywood stars to film, TV and theatre veteran Surekha Sikri.

item.title: Covid: Green Man festival sold out as return given go-ahead
item.description: Charlotte Church, Gruff Rhys and Mogwai are among acts booked with 20,000 revellers set to attend.

item.title: Sex Pistols in legal dispute over Danny Boyle's new TV series
item.description: Steve Jones and Paul Cook sue John Lydon over the use of the band's songs in Danny Boyle's Pistol.

item.title: Lil Durk: Grammy-nominated US rapper in shootout with intruders
item.description: The Grammy-nominated star, who recently topped the US album chart, was not injured in the incident.

item.title: The Broadway dancer whose lockdown business bloomed
item.description: When Covid closed New York theatres, dancer Robbie Fairchild started a business that put down roots.

item.title: James Norton: Why making Nowhere Special made me sob and want children
item.description: The Grantchester actor on the emotional toll of playing a dying father and why he doesn't mind fame.

item.title: David Bowie album artwork on sale in Shropshire auction
item.description: The collection belongs to artist Edward Bell who designed covers for the musician's records.

item.title: Debbie Harry on Blondie's 'monumental' Cuba trip and her reunion demands
item.description: The star recalls two historic concerts in Havana, and reveals her demand before reforming Blondie.

item.title: Why black TikTok creators have gone on strike
item.description: Backlash for "cultural appropriation" on the video-making app may mean no viral dances for a while.

item.title: Summer of Soul: New film revives lost 'Black Woodstock' gig series
item.description: Questlove's directorial debut uncovers lost gigs with Sly Stone, Stevie Wonder and Nina Simone.

item.title: Ghana's Kojo Marfo: Sell-out show for butcher-turned-painter
item.description: He's got rock star fans and two sold-out shows to his name, but Kojo Marfo prefers life's simple joys.

item.title: The Factory: Audiences get first glimpse in Â£186m Manchester arts venue
item.description: The Factory in Manchester is still a building site, but welcomes the public in for one weekend.

item.title: Covid: Can the arts lead the green recovery from the pandemic?
item.description: The pandemic has devastated the arts, but green shoots of recovery may be forming - in every sense.

item.title: Photographer's shopping centre exhibition shows the authentic face of black Britain
item.description: Cephas Williams turns a shopping centre into a gallery for his Portrait of Black Britain exhibition.

item.title: Amy Winehouse documentary 10 years on from death shows 'more rounded image'
item.description: The late singer's father says he hopes a new documentary will show a "more rounded image" of Amy.

item.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories: Why Hollywood stars like Ryan Reynolds are lining up
item.description: Other stars to have taken part include Tom Hardy, Dolly Parton and Sir Elton John. Here's why.

item.title: Indiana Jones scenes filmed in Glasgow city centre
item.description: Filming is in full swing in Glasgow city centre for the new Indiana Jones movie.

item.title: Summer of Soul: New film revives lost Harlem Cultural Festival of 1969
item.description: A new film, the Summer of Soul, will explore the Harlem Cultural Festival and why it was forgotten.

item.title: Rashford mural artist: 'Incredible how people have come together'
item.description: Street artist Akse, who has repaired his Rashford mural, says local people have united to show their support.

item.title: Ricky Gervais reflects on The Office's success
item.description: On the series' 20th anniversary, the BBC shows never-seen-before interview clips with Ricky Gervais.
